verses.roman:
tadābravīn nabho-vāṇī
balenaiva jito glahaḥ
dharmato vacanenaiva
rukmī vadati vai mṛṣā

synonyms: tadā—then; abravīt—spoke; nabhaḥ—in the sky; vāṇī—a voice; eva—indeed; jitaḥ—won; glahaḥ—the wager; dharmataḥ—fairly; vacanena—with words; eva—certainly; rukmī—Rukmī; vadati—speaks; vai—indeed; mṛṣā—duplicitous.
translation: Just then a voice from the sky declared, "Balarāma has fairly won this wager. Rukmī is surely lying."
